solution_line_template: For {months_returned} months, Shara was able to return ${amount_per_month} x {months_returned} = $<<{amount_per_month}*{months_returned}={total_returned_so_far}>>{total_returned_so_far} to her brother.
Since she already returned half of the money, then this means she currently owes her brother $<<{total_returned_so_far}={amount_currently_owed}>>{amount_currently_owed}.
Four months from now, she will be able to pay an additional ${amount_per_month} x {months_from_now} = $<<{amount_per_month}*{months_from_now}={additional_payment}>>{additional_payment}.
Thus, she will still owe her brother ${amount_currently_owed} - ${additional_payment} = $<<{amount_currently_owed}-{additional_payment}={remaining_debt}>>{remaining_debt} four months from now.
